00019 #ifndef __CLINKEDLIST_H
00020 #define __CLINKEDLIST_H
00021 
00022 #include "cownedobject.h"
00023 
00024 NAMESPACE_BEGIN
00025 
00026 #ifdef _MSC_VER
00027 #pragma warning(push, 0)  // deprecation warnings inside the header
00028 #endif
00029 
00030 #if defined __GNUC__ && __GNUC__ == 4 && __GNUC_MINOR__ >= 3
00031 // gcc-4.3.1 is broken: it insists on spitting out deprecation warnings for
00032 // cLinkedList::Iterator when this header gets included anywhere, and
00033 // cannot be convinced otherwise. #pragma GCC diagnostic does not work.
00034 // So we better forget deprecation with that compiler.
00035 #define CLINKEDLIST_DEPRECATED
00036 #else
00037 #define CLINKEDLIST_DEPRECATED  _OPPDEPRECATED
00038 #endif
00039 
00054 class SIM_API CLINKEDLIST_DEPRECATED cLinkedList : public cOwnedObject
00055 {
00056     // a list elem
00057     struct Elem
00058     {
00059         void *item;
00060         Elem *prev, *next;
00061     };
00062 
00063   public:
00064 
00071     class CLINKEDLIST_DEPRECATED Iterator
00072     {
00073       private:
00074         Elem *p;
00075 
00076       public:
00082         Iterator(const cLinkedList& q, bool athead=true)
00083                 {p=&q ? (athead ? q.headp : q.tailp) : NULL;}
00084 
00088         void init(const cLinkedList& q, bool athead=true)
00089                 {p=&q ? (athead ? q.headp : q.tailp) : NULL;}
00090 
00094         void *operator()() const  {return p->item;}
00095 
00100         bool end() const   {return (bool)(p==NULL);}
00101 
00105         void *operator++(int)  {if (!p) return NULL; Elem *t=p; p=p->next; return t->item;}
00106 
00110         void *operator--(int)  {if (!p) return NULL; Elem *t=p; p=p->prev; return t->item;}
00111     };
00112 
00113     friend class Iterator;
00114 
00115   private:
00116     Elem *headp, *tailp;      // inserting at head, removal at tail
00117     int n;                    // number of items in list
00118 
00119     VoidDelFunc delfunc;      // user func to free up item (NULL-->delete)
00120     VoidDupFunc dupfunc;      // user func to dupl. item (NULL-->new+memcpy)
00121     size_t itemsize;          // used in making shallow copy if dupfunc==0
00122                               // if both dupfunc and itemsize are 0, we do
00123                               // no memory management (we treat pointers as
00124                               // mere pointers)
00125   protected:
00126     // internal use.
00127     // if both dupfunc and itemsize are 0, we do no memory management
00128     // (we treat pointers as mere pointers)
00129     Elem *find_llelem(void *item) const;
00130 
00131     // internal use
00132     void insbefore_llelem(Elem *p, void *item);
00133 
00134     // internal use
00135     void insafter_llelem(Elem *p, void *item);
00136 
00137     // internal use
00138     void *remove_llelem(Elem *p);
00139 
00140   public:
00143 
00150     cLinkedList(const cLinkedList& llist);
00151 
00155     explicit cLinkedList(const char *name=NULL);
00156 
00160     virtual ~cLinkedList();
00161 
00169     cLinkedList& operator=(const cLinkedList& queue);
00171 
00174 
00180     virtual cLinkedList *dup() const  {return new cLinkedList(*this);}
00181 
00186     virtual std::string info() const;
00187 
00193     virtual void parsimPack(cCommBuffer *buffer);
00194 
00200     virtual void parsimUnpack(cCommBuffer *buffer);
00202 
00205 
00224     void config( VoidDelFunc _delfunc, VoidDupFunc _dupfunc, size_t _itemsize=0);
00225 
00229     void insert(void *item);
00230 
00235     void insertBefore(void *where, void *item);
00236 
00241     void insertAfter(void *where, void *item);
00242 
00247     void *head() const  {return n!=0 ? headp->item : NULL;}
00248 
00253     void *tail() const  {return n!=0 ? tailp->item : NULL;}
00254 
00259     void *remove(void *item);
00260 
00265     void *pop();
00266 
00270     int getLength() const {return n;}
00271 
00275     bool isEmpty() const {return n==0;}
00276 
00280     int length() const {return getLength();}
00281 
00285     bool empty() const {return isEmpty();}
00286 
00290     bool contains(void *item) const  {return find_llelem(item)!=NULL;}
00291 
00296     void clear();
00298 };
